title: Projects page: Add table view toggle (Cards | Table)
description:
**Task:** Add a UI toggle on the Projects page, just below the filters/sort/search/Open in YouTrack section, that allows users to switch between card view and a tabular view of projects.

**Approach:**
- Add view toggle (Cards | Table) in ProjectList (`src/components/ProjectList.tsx`) below the filter bar
- Create ProjectTable component in `src/components/ProjectTable.tsx`
- Table columns (per reference): Issue ID (clickable link to YouTrack), Summary, Status, Priority, Assignee, Initiative, Reporter, Created
- Reuse existing filter/sort logic from ProjectList — filteredProjects applies to both views
- Use Ticket type from `src/types/index.ts`
- Match design system: ocean (links), breeze (neutral), priority/status badge colors from ProjectCard (`getPriorityColor`, `getStateColor` patterns)
- Issue ID links: use `VITE_YOUTRACK_BASE_URL` or fallback, same pattern as ProjectCard `getYouTrackUrl`

**Context7 (Tailwind CSS v3):**
- `overflow-x-auto` on parent for horizontal scroll when table overflows (v3.tailwindcss.com/docs/overflow)
- `table-auto` for flexible column widths (v3.tailwindcss.com/docs/table-layout)
- `min-w-full` on table for full-width layout (v3.tailwindcss.com/docs/min-width)
- `divide-y divide-breeze-200` for row separators (v3.tailwindcss.com/docs/divide-width)
- Toggle buttons: use `group` + `group-hover` for active state styling, or `rounded-md px-3 py-1.5` with conditional `bg-ocean-500 text-white` vs `text-breeze-600 hover:bg-breeze-100`

**Context7 (React):**
- View toggle: `useState<"cards" | "table">("cards")` then conditional render: `viewMode === "table" ? <ProjectTable /> : <ProjectCardList />` (ternary pattern per React docs)

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] View toggle (Cards | Table) visible just below filters/sort/search/YouTrack bar on Projects page
- [ ] Table view displays columns: Issue ID, Summary, Status, Priority, Assignee, Initiative, Reporter, Created
- [ ] Issue ID links open YouTrack in new tab
- [ ] Filters and sort apply to both card and table views
- [ ] Table is responsive (horizontal scroll on narrow viewports via overflow-x-auto)
- [ ] Styling matches design system (ocean, breeze, priority/status badges)
close_reason: Added Cards/Table view toggle to ProjectList. Created ProjectTable component with columns: Issue ID (linked), Summary, Status, Priority, Assignee, Initiative, Reporter, Created. Filters and sort apply to both views. Responsive via overflow-x-auto.

title: Rezen File Downloader: process hangs + message channel errors
description:
**Task:** Investigate and fix the Rezen File Downloader tool hanging when used, and the repeated "message channel closed" console errors.

**Observed:**
- Process gets hung when using Rezen File Downloader
- Repeated console errors: `A listener indicated an asynchronous response by returning true, but the message channel closed before a response was received` (tools:1)
- Error appears many times (30+ in user report)

**Approach:**
- **Message channel error:** This is a known Chrome extension error — occurs when an extension's message listener returns `true` (async response) but the channel closes before responding. NOT from app code. Common culprits: React DevTools, Redux DevTools, password managers, ad blockers. Suggest testing in incognito (extensions disabled) to isolate. If hang persists without the error, the error is extension noise.
- **Hang investigation:** Client `handleRezenDownload` in tools.tsx (line 562) fetches `/api/rezen/download-transaction` or `/api/rezen/download-agent` with no timeout. Server (server/utils/rezen.js) fetches from reZEN APIs (arrakis, sherlock, dropbox), builds zip via archiver, streams response. For large transactions, this can take minutes. Client may appear hung while waiting.
- **Potential fixes:** (1) Add AbortController + timeout (e.g. 120s) to client fetch; (2) Add progress/status updates during long server operations; (3) Stream response with progress if possible; (4) Show "This may take several minutes for large transactions" message; (5) Ensure `setRezenDownloading(false)` runs on all paths (including fetch abort)
- **Server:** rezenFetch has 30s timeout per request; multiple sequential fetches (transaction → checklist → documents → dropbox files) can exceed that; archiver zip build adds more time. Consider timeout for overall handler.
- **Files:** src/pages/tools.tsx (handleRezenDownload), server/utils/rezen.js

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Root cause for hang identified (client timeout, server slowness, or extension interference)
- [ ] Client fetch has timeout/abort so UI doesn't appear frozen indefinitely
- [ ] User gets feedback during long operations (or clear "may take several minutes" message)
- [ ] Message channel error confirmed as extension-related (or fixed if app-caused)

title: Home page bar charts: Only bars pop on hover, not container; keep YouTrack click
description:
**Task:** Change the home page bar charts (Projects by Priority, Projects by Status) so that only the individual bars "pop up" on hover, not the entire card container. The click-to-open-YouTrack behavior must remain unchanged.

**Current behavior:**
- BarChartCard uses `.card` class (global.css line 49) which has `hover:scale-[1.02]` — entire container pops out on hover
- Bars have `onClick` and `cursor: pointer` for YouTrack navigation
- Both charts: handlePriorityBarClick, handleStatusBarClick in index.tsx

**Desired behavior:**
- Remove container hover pop (no scale/shadow change on card when hovering anywhere)
- Add bar-only hover effect: individual bars "pop up" (e.g. scale, fill change, or shadow) when hovering over a bar
- Click on bar still opens YouTrack — unchanged

**Approach:**
- **BarChartCard:** Use a non-interactive card variant for the wrapper — e.g. `card` without hover scale, or new class `card-static` / `chart-card` that omits `hover:scale-[1.02] hover:shadow-2xl`. Apply only to BarChartCard on home page, or add `noHoverScale` prop to use different wrapper class.
- **Bar hover:** Recharts Bar supports `activeBar` prop for styling the bar when hovered/active. Use `activeBar={{ fillOpacity: 1, strokeWidth: 1, ... }}` or custom `shape` with scale/transform. Alternatively, use CSS on the bar SVG elements (Recharts renders SVG) — `.recharts-bar-rectangle:hover { transform: scaleY(1.05) }` or similar. Recharts Bar/Cell may need `activeBar` or `activeShape` for per-bar hover.
- **Files:** src/components/BarChartCard.tsx, src/styles/global.css (if new class), src/pages/index.tsx (if BarChartCard needs prop)
- **Scope:** Home page bar charts only (Projects by Priority, Projects by Status). StatsCard and other cards keep current behavior unless explicitly changed.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Bar chart card containers do NOT pop/scale on hover
- [ ] Individual bars pop up (visual feedback) when hovering over a bar
- [ ] Clicking a bar still opens YouTrack in new tab
- [ ] Cursor remains pointer on bars only
- [ ] Other cards (StatsCard, etc.) unchanged

title: Rezen: Add file count to transaction validation
description:
**Task:** Perform a file count on transaction files during validation and include it in the validate-transaction response. Users should see how many files are associated with a transaction before downloading.

**Current behavior:**
- `/api/rezen/validate-transaction` (createValidateTransactionHandler in server/utils/rezen.js) returns `{ valid: true, transactionId, address }` when transaction exists
- No file count is returned
- Client (tools.tsx) shows address on valid, "Transaction not found" on invalid

**Desired behavior:**
- Validation response includes `fileCount` (number of downloadable files for that transaction)
- Client can display e.g. "123 Main St — 12 files" when valid
- File count should match what would be included in a download (checklist docs + dropbox files)

**Approach:**
- **Server:** Add a lightweight `getTransactionFileCount(transactionId)` in rezen.js that counts files without downloading content. Reuse existing helpers: getTransactionDetails → getChecklistItems → extractChecklistDocuments (count) + extractDropboxIds → getDropboxFiles (count). Do NOT call getChecklistDocDownloadUrl, getFileDownloadUrl, or downloadFileContent — only count. Return total count.
- **Validate handler:** Call `getTransactionFileCount` after `getTransactionDetails` succeeds. Include `fileCount` in response: `res.json({ valid: true, transactionId, address, fileCount })`
- **Client:** tools.tsx — when rezenValidation === 'valid', display file count alongside address (e.g. `${rezenValidatedAddress} — ${fileCount} files`). Handle optional fileCount for backward compatibility.
- **Files:** server/utils/rezen.js, src/pages/tools.tsx
- **Dev/prod parity:** Both proxy.js and production-server.js use createValidateTransactionHandler — no route changes needed

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Validate-transaction response includes fileCount when valid
- [ ] File count reflects checklist documents + dropbox files (same logic as download)
- [ ] Client displays file count in validation success state
- [ ] No unnecessary file downloads during validation (count-only)

title: Update Linear sync workflow: on-deploy vs worker dispatch
description:
**Task:** Change the Linear sync workflow trigger from push-to-main to on-deploy, and structure it as a reusable worker that can be dispatched by the deploy workflow.

**Approach:**
- Current: `.github/workflows/sync-beads-linear.yml` runs on push to main when `.beads/issues.jsonl` changes, plus workflow_dispatch
- Target: Run Linear sync when deployment completes (on-deploy) instead of on every push; use workflow_call so the deploy workflow can dispatch it
- Convert sync-beads-linear.yml to a reusable workflow (`workflow_call`) that accepts no inputs or optional inputs
- Add a deploy workflow (or update existing) that runs after successful deploy (e.g., Render webhook, or a deploy job) and calls the sync workflow via `uses`
- If deploy is external (Render auto-deploy on push), consider: (a) a deploy-status webhook from Render that triggers sync, or (b) keep workflow_dispatch for manual sync and add a `workflow_run` trigger that fires after a specific deploy workflow completes
- Update AGENTS.md Linear Sync section to describe the new trigger behavior
- Files: `.github/workflows/sync-beads-linear.yml`, `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` (or new deploy workflow), `AGENTS.md`

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Linear sync runs on deploy completion (or equivalent) rather than on push to main
- [ ] Sync workflow is reusable (workflow_call) and can be dispatched by deploy
- [ ] workflow_dispatch remains for manual sync
- [ ] AGENTS.md documents the updated trigger behavior

title: Investigate: initiatives fetch fallback + tags API 500 (YouTrack 400)
description:
**Task:** Investigate and fix two related YouTrack API failures: (1) initiatives fetch failing with fallback, (2) tags endpoint returning 500 (YouTrack 400 Bad Request).

**Observed errors:**
- `Failed to fetch initiatives from YouTrack, using fallback` — request.tsx line 210
- `api/youtrack/issues/ATOP-2332/tags?fields=id,name` — 500 response
- Response body: `{"error":"YouTrack API Error: 400 Bad Request"}`
- `Failed to apply tag: API Error: 500` — when adding Automation_Enhancement tag after issue creation

**Approach:**
- **Initiatives:** `src/pages/request.tsx` calls `youTrackService.getCustomFieldValues('Initiative')` on mount. Failure triggers fallback. Check: `src/services/youtrack.ts` getCustomFieldValues implementation; proxy/server route for custom fields; YouTrack API for Initiative field (field may not exist, have different name, or require different endpoint).
- **Tags:** `youTrackService.addTagToIssue(issueId, tagName)` in youtrack.ts line 271: `makeRequest(`/issues/${issueId}/tags`, { fields: 'id,name' }, 'POST', { name: tagName })`. Proxy route `server/routes/youtrack.js` line 81: POST /api/youtrack/issues/:issueId/tags — looks up tag via `/api/tags?fields=id,name&query=...`, then POSTs `{ id: tag.id }` to `/api/issues/:issueId/tags`. YouTrack 400 suggests wrong request format: maybe body should be `{ name }` not `{ id }`, or fields param invalid. Check YouTrack REST API docs for add-tag-to-issue.
- **Proxy error handling:** 500 wraps YouTrack 400 — consider surfacing YouTrack status/body to client for debugging.
- **Dev/prod parity:** Apply fixes to both `server/proxy.js` and `server/production-server.js` if server changes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Root cause identified for initiatives fetch failure
- [ ] Root cause identified for tags 400/500 (request format, endpoint, or permissions)
- [ ] Fixes applied; initiatives load from YouTrack when available
- [ ] Tag application succeeds (Automation_Enhancement or equivalent)
- [ ] Dev and prod server code kept in sync

title: Projects page: Export filtered/sorted report to CSV
description:
**Task:** Add an Export button on the Projects page that exports the current filtered and sorted report to a .csv file. The button should be inline with the Cards/Table view toggle row but not necessarily on the same side (e.g. view toggle left, export right).

**Approach:**
- **Placement:** Same row as View Toggle (Cards | Table), inline — e.g. `flex justify-between items-center` with view toggle on left, Export button on right. Or `flex items-center gap-4` with both in the row. User said "not necessarily on the same side" so opposite side is fine.
- **Data source:** Export `filteredProjects` — the same data shown in cards/table after filters, search, and sort are applied. Use ProjectList's filteredProjects (already computed).
- **CSV columns:** Match table view for consistency: Issue ID, Summary, Status, Priority, Assignee, Initiative, Reporter, Created. Optionally add Updated, Requestor. Use Ticket type from src/types/index.ts.
- **CSV generation:** Client-side only — build CSV string from filteredProjects, escape fields (quotes, commas, newlines per RFC 4180), create Blob, trigger download via `URL.createObjectURL` + `<a download>`. No server round-trip.
- **Filename:** e.g. `projects-export-YYYY-MM-DD.csv` or `projects-{timestamp}.csv`
- **Button styling:** Match design system (ocean, breeze). Use Download or FileDown icon from lucide-react. Same visual weight as Open in YouTrack / view toggle.
- **Files:** src/components/ProjectList.tsx (add Export button, export handler)
- **Utility:** Consider `src/utils/csvExport.ts` for `exportToCsv(rows, columns)` — reusable, testable. Escape: wrap in quotes if contains comma/newline/quote; double internal quotes.
- **Edge cases:** Empty filteredProjects — disable button or show "No data to export"; large exports — client-side is fine for typical project counts (hundreds).

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Export button visible inline with Cards/Table row (opposite side or same row)
- [ ] Clicking exports filteredProjects to .csv with correct columns
- [ ] CSV properly escaped (commas, quotes, newlines)
- [ ] Filename includes date or timestamp
- [ ] Filters, search, and sort all apply to exported data
- [ ] Button disabled or clear feedback when no projects to export

title: Investigate: KB search /api/zendesk/search 404 locally (works in production)
description:
**Task:** Investigate why the KB search tool returns 404 when calling POST /api/zendesk/search locally, while it works in production.

**Observed error:**
- `POST http://localhost:8000/api/zendesk/search 404 (Not Found)`
- tools.tsx:462 (fetch), handleKBSearch @ tools.tsx:493, onKeyDown @ tools.tsx:1153
- KB search works in production but not on local machine

**Approach:**
- **Client:** tools.tsx line 462 fetches `/api/zendesk/search` (relative URL) with POST, credentials: include
- **Dev setup:** Vite (port 8000) proxies `/api` to proxy server (port 3001) per vite.config.ts. Proxy must be running via `npm run dev` (concurrently proxy + vite).
- **Proxy route:** server/proxy.js line 127: `app.post('/api/zendesk/search', adminOnlyMiddleware, createZendeskSearchHandler())`
- **Production:** production-server.js line 71 has same route; serves both static + API
- **Possible causes:** (1) Proxy not running — user running only `vite` or `vite-only`; (2) Vite proxy target (localhost:3001) unreachable; (3) Route order — auth middleware or wildcard catching before zendesk; (4) Running `vite preview` instead of `vite` — preview serves static build, no API proxy; (5) Port conflict — proxy on different port
- **Verify:** Ensure `npm run dev` starts both proxy and vite; confirm proxy health at http://localhost:3001/health; test POST to http://localhost:3001/api/zendesk/search directly (with auth cookie)
- **Zendesk config:** server/utils/zendesk.js requires ZD_SUBDOMAIN, ZD_EMAIL, ZD_API_TOKEN — missing vars cause handler to throw (500), not 404
- **Dev/prod parity:** Both proxy.js and production-server.js have the route; document local setup if needed

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Root cause identified for local 404
- [ ] KB search works locally when proxy is running (or fix applied)
- [ ] README or dev docs updated if setup steps are required
